Description: Lip and neck sherd of Fikellura pottery trefoil oinochoe; glaze fired brown; interior reserved; exterior, white slip; exterior: lip glazed; maeander frieze on neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink 'NAU 45' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80, NAU45), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Miletus. For parallels, see British Museum oinochoe 1864,1007.149.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82, 84, fig. 3) (NAU 45)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.158)
